results.title: An Introduction to the frog
results.creator_credit: Thora James, Gaumont-British Instructional and J. Arthur Rank Organisation
results.brief_description: The frog is chosen as an example in an introduction to the subject of biology. The film shows the co-ordination between all systems of a typical vertebrate animal.

results.title: An Introduction to materials: the manufacture of silicon solar cells
results.creator_credit: Barrie Whatley, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: First of two films on solar cells. Includes an experiment to determine which wave lengths of light are absorbed by silicon. Describes the generation of electron-hole pairs and illustrates the process of drift, diffusion and recombination.

results.title: An Interview with Susan George
results.creator_credit: Mark Stiles, Mary Leggett and Freedom From Hunger
results.brief_description: Susan George, food economist and author of “How the other half dies” talks about food distribution in the world, reasons for starvation amongst third world peoples and the influence of the western world upon third world hunger problems.

results.title: An Interactive discovery tour of Victoria (PC)
results.brief_description: This program is produced under the auspices of Tourism Victoria and follows the campaign “You’ll love every piece of Victoria’. The main wonders of the State are presented in seven segments: Melbourne, Food and Wine, Shopping, Major Events, Arts and Culture, Regional Victoria, Location and Access. Aimed primarily at a foreign audience, the program is filled with maps, touring suggestions and good addresses as well as video interviews with Victorian identities. It is presented in 3 versions: Designed for PCs, this CD-ROM requires Windows 3.1 or above.

results.title: An Engineered timber building
results.brief_description: This film shows how engineers exploited the versatility of timber in the design of a new laboratory for the CSIRO Division of Forest Products. Only the outer frame and curtain wall of the building are of concrete and brick; the rest of the two-storey building, including the framework, is of timber.

results.title: An Awful moment
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and American Mutoscope and Biograph Company
results.brief_description: A judge finds himself the object of a gypsy woman’s anger and revenge when he passes sentence on her husband. Cast includes George Gebhardt, Marion Leonard, Harry Solter, Florence Lawrence, Linda Arvidson, Mack Sennett. Silent film with musical soundtrack and English intertitles.

results.title: An Astronaut's view of earth
results.creator_credit: Joseph Blatt, Chedd-Angier Productions and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description: An Astronauts view of the earth explores the history behind the development of space photography and discusses how human perceptions of themselves have been changed by this. A planet amongst planets, satellite photography has taught us about human scale and provides us with a snapshot of humans’ affect on the environment. A number of space shuttle astronauts draw connections between their work and the environment, science philosophy and history. With striking footage throughout, most notable being a full circle of the earth filmed from a satellite 180 miles out from earth. From the first aerial photograph to the sophisticated IMAX cameras this documentary charts the development of the technology used to photograph and film the earth and reveals a fragility of the earth with increasing clarity. Introduced by Dr. Patrick Moore, leading world cosmologist and narrated by William Shatner with music score by David Byrne and Pat Irwin.

results.title: An Airplane trip: an instructional sound film
results.brief_description: An instructional film of a plane trip. Dorothy and her mother travel from Los Angeles to salt Lake City. Shows and explains the duties involved in maintaining and servicing such a trip through the mechanics, stewardesses, and pilots and also includes the panoramic views as seen through the eyes of the passengers.

results.title: An Afternoon with Grigor Piatigorsky
results.brief_description: The life and art of one of this centuries greatest exponents of the cello. He performs the exquisite minuets 1 and 2 from the suite by Johann Sebastian Bach.

results.title: Amy on the lips
results.brief_description: An edited version of the feature film “Amy” starring Jenny Agutter and Barry Newman. Shows the attempts by one woman to teach deaf children to speak at the turn of this century. Suitable for Upper Primary, Early Secondary students. No other credits available.
